intro: Atropis suecica f. gigantea, commonly known as the giant Swedish atropis, is a rare and distinctive plant species belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its large, compound leaves that can reach up to 1 meter in length, giving it a striking appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in northern regions of Europe. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a conservation concern in many areas.
